test_cases.prompt:
Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the department's constitutional mandate?
How do you respond?
A. To provide secure and modern departmental services that are located within the state security system.
B. To enable socio-economic development and transformation by ensuring identity, status, and citizenship are key enablers of citizen empowerment and inclusivity, economic development, and national security.
C. To establish an effective border management authority and complete the modernization program.
D. To facilitate the importation of critical skills and tourism into South Africa through a risk-based and strategic approach to immigration.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What are the department's key priorities?
How do you respond?
A. Establishment of an effective Border Management Authority (BMA) and upgrading and redevelopment of six (6) key land ports of entry to One-Stop Border posts.
B. Completion of the modernization program, facilitating the importation of critical skills and tourism into South Africa through a risk-based and strategic approach to immigration, and repositioning the DHA as a secure and modern department located within the state security system.
C. Early birth registration, accelerated rollout of the smart ID card to all eligible persons, and access and footprint development to improve the reach of DHA services.
D. War on queues, immigration services performance, and Refugee Reception Offices.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: How did the COVID-19 pandemic affect the department's performance in the 2021/22 financial year?
How do you respond?
A. It had no impact on the department's performance.
B. It significantly improved the department's performance.
C. It had a negative impact on the department's performance.
D. It had a positive impact on the department's performance.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the purpose of the smart ID card?
How do you respond?
A. To enable the department to contribute to the MTSF priorities of government.
B. To improve the reach of DHA services, including purpose-fit DHA physical infrastructure and mobile offices.
C. To facilitate the importation of critical skills and tourism into South Africa through a risk-based and strategic approach to immigration.
D. To secure the population register while, at the same time, enabling access to identification, status, immigration, and citizenship services to qualifying citizens and residents.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the significance of the War on Queues?
How do you respond?
A. It is a campaign to minimize the time spent by citizens waiting in line for DHA services.
B. It is a program aimed at reducing the number of immigrants entering South Africa.
C. It is an initiative to combat corruption within the DHA.
D. It is a plan to improve the security of the country's borders.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What were some of the key interventions aimed at eradicating queues in the offices?
How do you respond?
A. Piloting of Branch Appointment Booking Systems (BABS) in all offices that can process Smart ID Cards and passports.
B. Inclusion of seven offices in the Presidential Infrastructure Priorities offices.
C. Implementation of an online birth registration system in 1445 public health facilities.
D. Introduction of a "War on Queues" program.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What was the outcome of the pilot project of the online birth registration system?
How do you respond?
A. All 1445 public health facilities were fully equipped with the online birth registration system.
B. Only 160 health facilities were equipped with the online birth registration system, which is responsible for 63% of births delivered.
C. The project was abandoned due to a lack of funding.
D. The project was successful, and all children born in health facilities left with a birth certificate.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What was the ultimate goal of the Early Birth Registration Strategy?
How do you respond?
A. To register all births in health facilities with maternity wards within 30 days of birth.
B. To ensure that all children born in health facilities leave with a birth certificate.
C. To reduce the number of births delivered in health facilities.
D. To increase the number of health facilities with maternity wards.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: How many health facilities were responsible for 85% of births delivered, and how many have been covered by the department so far?
How do you respond?
A. 251 health facilities were responsible for 85% of births delivered, and the department has covered 160 of them.
B. 1445 health facilities were responsible for 85% of births delivered, and the department has covered 160 of them.
C. 251 health facilities were responsible for 63% of births delivered, and the department has covered 160 of them.
D. 1445 health facilities were responsible for 63% of births delivered, and the department has covered 160 of them.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the department’s plan to address the remaining 91 facilities?
How do you respond?
A. The department will submit a business case to National Treasury to request additional funding for the remaining health facilities.
B. The department will look for self-financing options to fund the remaining health facilities.
C. The department will prioritize the 251 health facilities where the majority of births occur and forget about the remaining 91 facilities.
D. The department will close down the 160 health facilities it has managed to establish a presence in and focus on the remaining 91 facilities.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What was the outcome of the consultation process on the Green Paper on Marriages?
How do you respond?
A. The Department received more than 1000 submissions from the public and stakeholders, and the Green Paper was revised and submitted to Cabinet as a draft White Paper.
B. The consultation process was inconclusive, and the Green Paper was not revised or submitted to Cabinet.
C. The Department received fewer than 100 submissions from the public and stakeholders, and the Green Paper was not revised or submitted to Cabinet.
D. The consultation process was halted due to a lack of interest from the public and stakeholders.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the significance of the One-Stop Border Post (OSBP) Policy?
How do you respond?
A. To enable South Africans and residents of different sexual orientation, religious and cultural persuasions to conclude legal marriages.
B. To guide the development of a new legislation that will regulate the establishment and management of OSBPs in SA.
C. To amend the Electoral Act 73 of 1998.
D. To address child marriages.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What was the reason for the amendment of the Electoral Act 73 of 1998?
How do you respond?
A. To accommodate independent candidates in national and provincial elections.
B. To address the defects in the Electoral Act 1998 as per the Constitutional Court judgement.
C. To introduce a mixed-member proportional electoral system.
D. To modify the existing multi-member electoral system.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What were the two options proposed by the Ministerial Advisory Committee (MAC) for the electoral system?
How do you respond?
A. The minimalist model and the mixed-member model.
B. The first-past-the-post model and the proportional representation model.
C. The single-member constituency model and the multi-member constituency model.
D. The mixed-member proportional model and the single-transferable-vote model.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What was the outcome of the public consultations on the Electoral Amendment Bill?
How do you respond?
A. The minimalist model was adopted.
B. The mixed-member model was adopted.
C. The public consultations are still ongoing.
D. The Electoral Amendment Bill was withdrawn.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the current status of the Electoral Amendment Bill?
How do you respond?
A. The Bill has been tabled in Parliament for public consultations.
B. The Bill has been passed by Parliament and is awaiting the President's signature.
C. The Bill has been withdrawn due to public outcry.
D. The Bill has been rejected by Cabinet.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the current staff complement of the DHA, and what is the approved structure?
How do you respond?
A. The current staff complement of the DHA is 8,277 employees, and the approved structure provides for 19,886 posts.
B. The current staff complement of the DHA is 19,886 employees, and the approved structure provides for 8,277 posts.
C. The current staff complement of the DHA is 4,556 employees, and the approved structure provides for 12,345 posts.
D. The current staff complement of the DHA is 12,345 employees, and the approved structure provides for 4,556 posts.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the purpose of the capacitation business case developed by the DHA?
How do you respond?
A. To address capacity challenges experienced by the department.
B. To establish the BMA and transfer frontline functions to it.
C. To review the issuance of permits and root out fraud and corruption.
D. To implement the recommendations of the Task Team on the APP targets.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the fundamental right that every employee of the Department of Home Affairs is constitutionally mandated to defend for all persons?
How do you respond?
A. The right to freedom, justice, and security.
B. The right to legal record of existence.
C. The right to citizenship and nationality.
D. The right to social and economic equality.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the “scandal of invisibility” that the Department of Home Affairs is working to eliminate?
How do you respond?
A. The lack of access to identification documents for foreign nationals.
B. The absence of a legal record of existence for all persons who live in the country, irrespective of their status.
C. The failure to provide adequate protection to foreign nationals as prescribed in domestic law and international commitments.
D. The inability to affirm or grant citizenship and issue visas or permits to qualifying non-citizens.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What are the services that the Department of Home Affairs provides to safeguard the sovereignty and national security of the State?
How do you respond?
A. Visa and permit services, birth registration, and passport issuance.
B. Marriage and death certificates, identity document issuance, and passport services.
C. Early birth registration, optimization of birth registration, and statelessness eradication.
D. Sustainable Development Goal implementation, national security maintenance, and foreign national tracking.

Question: What is the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goal that the Department of Home Affairs is working towards in relation to birth registration?

A. Sustainable Development Goal 3: Good Health and Well-being
B. Sustainable Development Goal 16: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions
C. Sustainable Development Goal 4: Quality Education
D. Sustainable Development Goal 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth

How do you respond?
A. To provide secure, efficient, and accessible services and enabling documents to citizens and residents.
B. To facilitate and regulate the secure movement of people through ports of entry into and out of South Africa, to determine the status of asylum seekers, and to regulate refugee affairs.
C. To strengthen efforts aimed at improving the stability of the system and network.
D. To provide strategic leadership, management, and support services to the department.

D. Ms. unknown

How do you respond?
A. To provide strategic leadership, management, and support services to the department.
B. To facilitate and regulate the secure movement of people through ports of entry into and out of South Africa.
C. To ensure that registration at birth is the only entry point to the population register.
D. To determine the status of asylum seekers and regulate refugee affairs.

Question: How has the Covid-19 pandemic affected the operations of the Department of Home Affairs?
How do you respond?
A. It has made it difficult for the department to provide essential services such as issuing birth and death certificates, identity documents, and visas.
B. It has highlighted the need for the department to refocus itself as an organ within the security cluster and apparatus of the state.
C. It has not had any impact on the operations of the department.
D. It has made it easier for the department to return to pre-Covid levels of production and get 100% of staff back at the office.

How do you respond?
A. Issuing birth and death certificates, identity documents, and visas.
B. Providing secure, efficient, and accessible services and enabling documents to citizens and residents.
C. Facilitating and regulating the secure movement of people through ports of entry into and out of South Africa.
D. Determining the status of asylum seekers and regulating refugee affairs.

Question: How does the department of Home Affairs collect revenue?
How do you respond?
A. Through the National Revenue Fund (NRF).
B. Through DIRCO employees on an agent principle basis at missions where the department does not have a presence.
C. Through the e-Visa system.
D. Through the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC).

Question: What is the purpose of the e-Visa system?
How do you respond?
A. To facilitate and regulate the secure movement of people through ports of entry into and out of South Africa.
B. To make it easier for eligible travelers to complete the online application forms in the comfort of their homes and submit these to Home Affairs without visiting our missions abroad.
C. To assist the department in discharging its mandate in accordance with the Immigration Act, 2002, and the Refugees Act, 1998.
D. To provide institutional support and transfer funds to the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC), the Represented Political Parties’ Fund, and the Border Management Authority (BMA).

How do you respond?
A. To ensure free and fair elections.
B. To assist the department in discharging its mandate in accordance with the Immigration Act, 2002, and the Refugees Act, 1998.
C. To coordinate and manage the provision of services through front offices at the provincial level.
D. To modernize and streamline the visa application process.

A. 32
B. 14
C. 8
D. 2

How do you respond?
A. Procurement delays.
B. Protracted consultation process.
C. Impact of Covid 19.
D. Delays in finalizing the Section 97 proclamation pertaining to the transfer of functions in respect of the BMA.

Question: What was the directive given by the Constitutional Court in the New Nation Movement NPC and Others v the President of South Africa matter?
How do you respond?
A. The Electoral Act 73 of 1998 was declared unconstitutional, and Parliament was directed to rectify the defective sections within 24 months.
B. The Constitutional Court directed the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) to allow adult citizens to be elected to the National Assembly (NA) and Provincial Legislatures (PLs) through their membership of political parties.
C. The Constitutional Court declared that the Representative Political Parties Fund was unconstitutional and directed the Government Printing Works (GPW) to stop providing security printing for the State.
D. The Constitutional Court ordered the department to achieve 69% of its APP targets within the 2021/22 financial year.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the purpose of the Electoral Amendment Bill tabled in Parliament in 2021?
How do you respond?
A. To amend the Electoral Act 73 of 1998 to ensure free and fair elections.
B. To provide security printing for the State, such as passports and identity documents.
C. To enable public consultations on the Green Paper on the management of citizenship, international migration, and refugee protection.
D. To transfer the functions of the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) to the Government Printing Works (GPW).

Question: What is the overall performance of the department in achieving its APP targets in the 2021/22 financial year?
How do you respond?
A. The department achieved 71% of its APP targets.
B. The department achieved 69% of its APP targets.
C. The department achieved 80% of its APP targets.
D. The department achieved 90% of its APP targets.

Question: Which programmes did not achieve their targets and why?
How do you respond?
A. Administration, because the procurement delays and the impact of Covid 19 affected the achievement of the targets.
B. Citizen Affairs, because the consultation process took longer than expected.
C. Immigration Affairs, because the targets were not achievable due to the limited number of Immigration officials available to process applications.
D. Institutional Support and Transfers, because the Section 97 proclamation pertaining to the transfer of functions in respect of the BMA was not finalized.

A. Procurement delays due to a global shortage of computer chips.
B. The impact of Covid-19 restrictions on the number of immigration officials available to process applications.
C. Delays in finalizing the Section 97 proclamation pertaining to the transfer of functions in respect of the BMA.
D. Protracted consultation processes.

D. The DHA Bill has been rejected by Cabinet and is being redrafted.

Question: What is the reason for the delay in the finalisation of the Green Paper on the management of citizenship, international migration and refugee protection?

B. The impact of Covid-19 restrictions on the number of immigration officials available to process applications.
C. Protracted consultation processes.
D. Delays in finalising the Section 97 proclamation pertaining to the transfer of functions in respect of the BMA.

Question: What is the BMA, and what is its purpose?
How do you respond?
A. BMA stands for "Border Management Agency," and its purpose is to manage and regulate the flow of people and goods across South Africa's borders.
B. BMA stands for "Borders and Management Agency," and its purpose is to ensure the safety and security of South Africa's borders.
C. BMA stands for "Business Management Agency," and its purpose is to support small businesses and entrepreneurs in South Africa.
D. BMA stands for "Bureau of Management Assistance," and its purpose is to provide administrative support to other government agencies.

Respond to the following question with single letter answer.

Question: What is the purpose of the Section 97 proclamation?
How do you respond?
A. To establish the BMA SARS protocol.
B. To incorporate frontline immigration, port health, border facility management, and agriculture functions into the BMA.
C. To grant interim custodial powers, duties, and responsibilities to the Minister of Home Affairs for Oshoek, Lebombo, Ficksburg, and Maseru ports of entry.
D. To finalize the transfer of functions to the BMA.

A. The implementation of the IMS delegations was successful and has improved service delivery.

C. The implementation of the IMS delegations was delayed due to the Covid-19 pandemic and is still in the process of being implemented.
D. The implementation of the IMS delegations was a failure and has not improved service delivery.

Question: What is the reason for the delay in finalizing the BMA Defence implementation protocol?
How do you respond?
A. The Minister for Public Works and Administration has not assigned interim custodial powers, duties, and responsibilities to the Minister of Home Affairs for Oshoek, Lebombo, Ficksburg, and Maseru ports of entry.
B. The SANDF has not provided a revised draft of the BMA Defense implementation protocol for signature.
C. The Section 97 proclamations by means of which the frontline functions would have been incorporated into the BMA were not finalized as concurrence on e.g. the health functions was not received.
D. The BMA SARS protocol has not been signed, and 10 port coordinators have not been appointed.
